intro: Guarea bijuga, commonly known as the black guarea, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its dark, heavy wood and compound leaves with elongated leaflets. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds.
